title: Verified Purchase
content: Frankie McGrath, a seasoned combat nurse is home suffering from PTSD.  Only they didn't call it that then.  She's seeking assistance from friends,  family,  and the VA.  Everyone tells her there were no women in Vietnam.  Even her upper-crust family told their friends she was studying abroad.  The whole country is angry at returning veterans and booing them in the media and on the streets.  Hannah weaves a tale about one woman's journey and how she copes or doesn't cope.  There's passion,  romance,  betrayal,  death,  grief,  and incredible frustration in these pages.  But you need to read this!  It's a story about the women who were in Vietnam,  who patched the wounded and held the hands of dying men,  all while shells exploded around them and the rat-tat-tat of guns.  These women didn't run except toward landing choppers full of wounded and dying men.  Their days were endless and the war was grinding on relentlessly.  They formed friendships that lasted lifetimes and later discovered that maybe their friends were the only hope they had in the face of an ungrateful nation.  This was a dark stain on our nation's history and this story drives that home.  Hey!  Kristin Hannah writes amazing books and tells an awesome story.  This is one you won't put down and will stay with you long after the last page.
